intro: Stanleya tomentosa var. typica, commonly known as the woolly goldenstar, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It features a basal rosette of fuzzy, gray-green leaves covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers in late spring, forming showy, star-like clusters atop tall, hairy stems. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and woodland habitats. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a notable species in its native ecosystem.
